titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يَحُجُّ عَنْ غَيْرِهِ فَحَجَّ عَنْ غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ أَوْ يَطُوفُ عَنْ غَيْرِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 67 – A man performs Hajj on behalf of someone else, so he performs Hajj on behalf of someone other than that one, or circumambulates on behalf of someone else

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يَحُجُّ عَنْ غَيْرِهِ فَحَجَّ عَنْ غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ أَوْ يَطُوفُ عَنْ غَيْرِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 67 – A man performs Hajj on behalf of someone else, so he performs Hajj on behalf of someone other than that one, or circumambulates on behalf of someone else

text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ يَحْيَى الْأَزْرَقِ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) الرَّجُلُ يَحُجُّ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَصْلُحُ لَهُ أَنْ يَطُوفَ عَنْ أَقَارِبِهِ فَقَالَ إِذَا قَضَى مَنَاسِكَ الْحَجِّ فَلْيَصْنَعْ مَا شَاءَ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan Bin yahya, from Yahya Al Arzaq who said,

‘I said to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The man performs Hajj on behalf of the man, would it be correct for him if he were to circumambulate on behalf of his relatives?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When he fulfils the rituals of the Hajj, so let him do whatever he so desires to’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى رَفَعَهُ قَالَ سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَعْطَى رَجُلًا مَالًا يَحُجُّ عَنْهُ فَحَجَّ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ فَقَالَ هِيَ عَنْ صَاحِبِ الْمَالِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, raising it, said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> was asked about a man who gave wealth to a man to perform Hajj on his behalf, but he performed Hajj for himself. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It would be (Reckoned as being) on behalf of the owner of the wealth’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ رِجَالِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ أَخَذَ مِنْ رَجُلٍ مَالًا وَ لَمْ يَحُجَّ عَنْهُ وَ مَاتَ لَمْ يُخَلِّفْ شَيْئاً قَالَ إِنْ كَانَ حَجَّ الْأَجِيرُ أُخِذَتْ حَجَّتُهُ وَ دُفِعَتْ إِلَى صَاحِبِ الْمَالِ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ حَجَّ كُتِبَ لِصَاحِبِ الْمَالِ ثَوَابُ الْحَجِّ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from one of his men,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding a man who took wealth from a man and did not perform Hajj on his behalf, and died, and did not leave anything. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If it was such that the hired one had performed (his own) Hajj, his Hajj would be seized and handed over to the owner of the wealth. And, if had not performed Hajj, (even then) the Rewards of the Hajj would be Written for the owner of the wealth’.
